project_context.project_vision: Modular CLI platform for authentic Srila Prabhupada texts with extensible devotional tools
project_context.target_audience: Hare Krishna devotees, ISKCON communities, spiritual seekers, scholars

primary_problems.description: Fragmented devotional app ecosystem lacks cohesive modular platform
primary_problems.evidence: 150+ standalone Hare Krishna apps without interoperability
primary_problems.impact: Developers duplicate effort, users manage multiple apps

primary_problems.description: Sanskrit diacritical marks display incorrectly across EPUB readers
primary_problems.evidence: Font embedding required, some Android readers use wrong fonts

primary_problems.description: No verification system for unmodified original texts
primary_problems.evidence: Digital preservation authenticity concerns for sacred texts
primary_problems.impact: Trust issues, potential unauthorized edits go undetected

user_stories.i_want: Read original Prabhupada books in CLI with correct Sanskrit characters
user_stories.so_that: I can study authentic texts on any device without GUI overhead
acceptance_criteria: All Sanskrit diacritical marks display correctly

user_stories.i_want: Verify text authenticity via checksums or digital signatures
user_stories.so_that: I can trust the texts are unmodified originals
acceptance_criteria: Original BBT (Bhaktivedanta Book Trust) sources cited

user_stories.i_want: Extend PrabhupadaOS with custom plugins (calendar, tracker, etc.)
user_stories.so_that: I can build on shared infrastructure without reinventing text parsing
acceptance_criteria: Plugins can access parsed book data

user_stories.i_want: Access structured book data for translation pipeline
user_stories.so_that: I can translate books to all world languages systematically

in_scope_mvp: CLI E-book Reader for Prabhupada texts
EPUB Parser with Sanskrit font support

technical: Must preserve original text integrity (no modifications)
Must work offline (no mandatory internet dependency)
